ZIGBEE-based Wireless Sensor Network for Landslide Monitoring
ISRO Respond Project Status: Active Openings: No
The main objective of this project is to build a network of sensor nodes to monitor the various physical quantities of interest such as pore water pressure rainfall and soil movement with the goal of monitoring land-slide prone areas and possibly predicting shallow landslides. We also want the monitoring platform to be robust, cost-effective, energy-efficient, and easy to deploy. In this project, we would also like to explore the possibility of a model and algorithm that takes as input the geography of the area, node density, and other related parameters, and minimizes deployment cost by identifying the minimum set of sensors needed at every node.

Project members:
  • Lomin Joy V., Junior Research Fellow, Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
    Apr 2020 - Present
Project Allocation Portal
UG Project Status: Completed
Our initial motivations of making this portal was to reduce the drudgery people have to go through due to manual project allocation in this modern erawhere everything is code driven. We have seen that most of the project allocations are done using GoogleDocs or Excel - a tiresome and time-consuming process. So, we came up with a web-based solution that uses an algorithm to allocate projects after collecting preferences from students and mentors.

Project members:
  • Subhash S., B. Tech, Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
    Jan 2020 - Jul 2020
  • Sai Vamsi Alisetti, B. Tech, Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
    Jan 2020 - Jul 2020

Cloud-based Solution for Timetable Automation
UG Project Status: Inactive
This project aims to develop a cloud-based solution where faculty and academic section can enter data about courses offered in a semester, list of faculties offering courses, slot systems, and details of available rooms. It should also provide a workflow that allows academic section to create an optimal timetable (room-slot-course allocation) taking into consideration the various constraints.

Interactive Video Wall
UG Project Status: Inactive

Wifi-Enabled IoT-Based Smart Lock
UG Project Status: Inactive
The goal is to design an IOT based smart door-lock which can be operated over a Wifi network using an android application. One would need an authentication mechanism to lock or unlock the door. Hardware implementation of the lock will use an Arduino board, DC motor, NODE MCU ESP8266 Wifi module and batteries to provide power to the lock. This project also involves the design of a locking mechanism (with rack, pinion, and a place fixing the servo motor) and realizing it using a 3D printer.

Project members:
  • Avinash Kumar Sharma, B. Tech. , Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
    Jan 2020 - Apr 2020
  • Md Talha Yaseen Khan, B. Tech. , Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad

Secure Linux Voice Command Controller
UG Project Status: Inactive
This project aims to develop a secure voice-based controller for Linux desktops to recognize voice commands for basic functionalities (for example, the opening of applications and basic control of applications) and perform them similar to commercial virtual assistants. This voice-based controller should be secure, that is it should be able to recognize the speaker and run voice command only for a registered speaker.

Project members:
  • Libin N George, B. Tech. , Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
    Jul 2018 - Apr 2019
SahaYatra - A Ride Sharing App
UG Project Status: Completed
Several attempts on developing ride service platforms have been made. Some are paid, while others are open sourced. But all these projects do not have enough flexibility in terms of ride sharing and ride scheduling. The goal of this project is to fill this void by creating a new ride sharing platform.

Project members:
  • Pankaj Kumar, B. Tech. , Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
    Jul 2019 - Apr 2020
  • Jayaprakash A, B. Tech. , Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
    Jul 2018 - Apr 2019
